channel.title: World
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from World, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Despair for would-be US citizens as American dream blocked by Trump
item.description: Aspirant Americans tell of exclusions from ceremonies by sudden policy introduced on ‘security’ grounds The occasion should have been marked by the jo...

item.title: Renewable energy project approvals hit record high in GB in 2025, data shows
item.description: Applications to build battery storage drive boom as offshore wind projects given go-ahead jump sevenfold year on year A record number of renewable ene...

item.title: UK’s warmest spring on record led to rise in songbirds breeding, data shows
item.description: Dry and warm 2025 spring gave glimmer of hope for threatened wild birds but many remain in long-term decline The warmest and sunniest spring on record...

item.title: Ukraine war live: Russia gives ‘no plausible evidence’ to back up claim of drone attack on Putin’s residence
item.description: Ukraine’s foreign minister Andrii Sybiha responds to claims by Moscow of a strike on home in Russia’s Novgorod region Germany’s chancellor, Friedrich ...

item.title: Eurostar trains cancelled and delayed due to Channel tunnel problem
item.description: Passengers urged to change plans after problem with overhead power supply and failed Le Shuttle train Business live – latest updates Passengers planni...

item.title: Power outage hits Channel Tunnel as Eurostar urges passengers to postpone travel
item.description: Le Shuttle has also had to suspend services between Folkestone and Calais over a "power supply issue".

item.title: French right pushes for national tribute to film star Brigitte Bardot
item.description: A petition for a national homage to Brigitte Bardot - who died on Sunday - attracts more than 23,000 signatures.

item.title: Blue Origin astronaut reveals depression after 'tsunami of harassment'
item.description: Blue Origin's all-female crew, which included scientist Amanda Nguyen, was launched into space in April.

item.title: Ukraine denies drone attack on Putin's residence
item.description: Russia has accused Ukraine of targeting a presidential residence, which President Zelensky called "typical Russian lies".

item.title: Johnson to decide future after Palace deal agreed
item.description: Brennan Johnson is set decide whether he wants to join Crystal Palace after the south London club agreed a £35m deal to sign the Tottenham attacker.
